definition: to crowd in/to cram in/to force others aside/to press/to squeeze/to find (time in one's busy schedule)
to come/to arrive/to come round/ever since/next
to crowd in/to cram in/to force others aside/to press/to squeeze/to find (time in one's busy schedule)

to go/to go to (a place)/(of a time etc) last/just passed/to send/to remove/to get rid of/to reduce/to be apart from in space or time/to die (euphemism)/to play (a part)/(when used either before or after a verb) to go in order to do sth/(after a verb of motion indicates movement away from the speaker)/(used after certain verbs to indicate detachment or separation)

sentences.english: I struggled through the mass of people to the exit .
sentences.chinese: 我在人羣中擠來擠去，擠到了出口處。

sentences.english: The crowd was pushing and shoving to get a better view.
sentences.chinese: 人們擠來擠去，想看得清楚點兒。

sentences.english: I'm not used to being pushed in the huge crowd of people.
sentences.chinese: 我不習慣於在人羣中被擠來擠去。

sentences.english: I hate all the hustle and bustle of Saturday shopping.
sentences.chinese: 我討厭星期六買東西那麼擠來擠去的。

sentences.english: I hate all the hustle ( and bustle) of Saturday shopping.
sentences.chinese: 我討厭星期六買東西那麼擠來擠去的。

sentences.english: I hate all the hustle of Saturday shopping.
sentences.chinese: 我討厭星期六買東西擠來擠去的。

sentences.english: Cars are used to bullying and jostling their way across the full expanse of the road.
sentences.chinese: 汽車習慣於在公路的各個車道擠來擠去。
